Question_1.Context: The study aimed to develop an anti-acne preparation from active anti-bacterial medicinal plants. Essential oils were extracted and analyzed for their anti-acne activities against Cutibacterium acnes ATCC 6919.
Question_1.Question: Which essential oils showed the highest antimicrobial activity against C. acnes?
Question_1.Source: Marjoram and chrysanthemum oils showed the highest antimicrobial activity against C. acnes (MIC = 0.156% v/v and 0.125% v/v, respectively).

Question_2.Context: The antibacterial activity of essential oils against Cutibacterium acnes ATCC 6919 was evaluated. The minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) and minimum bactericidal concentration (MBC) were determined.
Question_2.Question: Which essential oil had the lowest MIC against C. acnes?
Question_2.Source: Chrysanthemum oil had the lowest MIC against C. acnes (MIC = 0.125% v/v).

Question_3.Context: The study involved the formulation of film-forming nanogels with essential oils for anti-acne activity. The nanogels were characterized for particle size, polydispersity index, and zeta potential.
Question_3.Question: What was the particle size of the plain nanogel?
Question_3.Source: The measured particle size of the plain nanogel was 550.5 ± 26.09 nm.

Question_4.Context: The film-forming nanogels were evaluated for their pH values. The pH values of the plain nanogel, marjoram, and chrysanthemum oil-loaded nanogels were determined.
Question_4.Question: What was the pH value of the marjoram oil-loaded nanogel?
Question_4.Source: The pH value of the marjoram oil-loaded nanogel was 4.85 ± 0.03.

Question_5.Context: The in vivo anti-acne activity of marjoram and chrysanthemum oils-loaded nanogels was evaluated in a murine acne infection model. The effect on bacterial load and histopathological analysis was assessed.
Question_5.Question: Which treatment group showed the most reduction in bacterial counts compared to the plain formula group?
Question_5.Source: Chrysanthemum oil formula exhibited the most reduction in bacterial counts, followed by erythromycin and marjoram, respectively.

Question_6.Context: The study evaluated the expression of nuclear factor erythroid 2–related factor 2 (Nrf2) and tumor necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α) in response to oxidative stress and inflammation.
Question_6.Question: Which group showed the most significant increase in Nrf2 expression compared to the normal control group?
Question_6.Source: Marjoram oil formula showed marked elevation in Nrf2 expression compared to the normal control group.

Question_7.Context: The expression of tumor necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α) was evaluated in response to inflammation. Different treatment groups were compared for their effect on TNF-α expression.
Question_7.Question: Which group showed the most significant reduction in TNF-α expression compared to the acne-infected mice group?
Question_7.Source: Chrysanthemum oil formula exhibited marked reduction in TNF-α expression compared to the acne-infected mice group.

Question_8.Context: The study aimed to develop a safe phytopharmaceutical formulation with anti-acne activity. The in vitro antibacterial activity of essential oils against Cutibacterium acnes was evaluated.
Question_8.Question: Which essential oil exhibited the highest bactericidal concentration (MBC) against C. acnes?
Question_8.Source: Marjoram oil had the highest bactericidal concentration (MBC = 1.781% v/v) against C. acnes.

Question_9.Context: The study involved the preparation and characterization of film-forming nanogels with essential oils for anti-acne activity. The viscosity of the nanogels was measured.
Question_9.Question: What was the viscosity of the chrysanthemum oil-loaded nanogel?
Question_9.Source: The viscosity of the chrysanthemum oil-loaded nanogel was 1,997 ± 76 cp.

Question_10.Context: The study evaluated the in vivo anti-acne activity of marjoram and chrysanthemum oils-loaded nanogels in a murine acne infection model. The effect on bacterial load and histopathological analysis was assessed.
Question_10.Question: Which treatment group showed the most reduction in TNF-α expression compared to the acne-infected mice group?
Question_10.Source: Chrysanthemum oil formula exhibited marked reduction in TNF-α expression compared to the acne-infected mice group.
